result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Harrison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Indecent Behavior with a Child, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.11(2).
  • Indecent Behavior with a Child, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.11(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count #2. Credit given for ZERO days time served if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
* Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
* No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 years.

* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Restitution to be addressed by the parties without the Court's assistance as set forth on the record.

* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2: SERVE 1 YEAR "condition time" at the House of Correction - STAYED. To be used at the discretion of the Probation Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count #1. Credit given for ZERO days time served if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Harrison

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: email exchange, received and filed for purposes of scanning
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Atty. Patrick Cafferty on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Robert Harrison in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:   Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS, concurrent to Count #2.
Credit given for ZERO days time served if revoked.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS, concurrent to Count #1.
Credit given for ZERO days time served if revoked.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 10 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* SERVE 1 YEAR "condition time" at the House of Correction - STAYED.  To be used at the discretion of the Probation Department.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 years.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.


OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Restitution to be addressed by the parties without the Court's assistance as set forth on the record.

  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Defendant Robert Harrison in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:    Defendant changes plea to "NO CONTEST". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defense moves to withdraw defense's motion to dismiss filed on 11-09-2015.
No objections. 
Court allows defense's motion to dismiss to be withdrawn.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Robert Harrison in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  
Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

CASE REVIEWED OFF THE RECORD BY THE COURT DUE TO JURY TRIAL (unrelated case).  Matter before the Court for Motion Hearing.  Defense intends to withdraw motion.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  The Court is unable to hear this matter this morning due to jury trial/time constraints.  ADA Shomin is not available later this date.  Defense request for short adjournment granted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Upon the email request of the attorneys, Clerk rescheduled the 01-29-2016 at 10:00 AM Motion Hearing to Challenge Statute of Limitations to 03-04-2016 at 10:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Robert Harrison in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Scheduling Conference held.
Defense plans to file a motion to challenge the statute of limitations.
Case adjourned to 01-29-2016 at 10:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Motion Hearing.
filed by Atty. Patrick Cafferty on behalf of the defendant.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (10/22/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Oral No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with R.R. and R.A.K.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant Robert Harrison in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 10/21/15 @ 1:30pm
